Detailed Description

A RadioButtonControl represents a radiobutton, which may be selected or unselected. A radiobutton defines a "one of many" choice and hence makes only sense as part of a radiobutton-group. A radiobutton-group is defined by the class RadioButtonGroup and takes care, that only one radiobutton is selected.
See also:
RadioButtonGroup

) 
 

Parameters:
parent Pointer to the window, which embeds the radiobutton-control.
group Pointer to the radiobutton-group, which manages the selection and deselection of grouped radiobuttons.
text Pointer to the text of the radiobutton-control.
selected Flag, whether the radiobutton is selected.

BOOLEAN RadioButtonControl::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Used by Aragon to read out the windows property out of the resource parser. It is not allowed for an application developer to invoke this method in a direct manner.

Reimplemented from AbstractButton.

void RadioButtonControl::SetSelected (  BOOLEAN  selected  )  [inline]
 

Marks the radiobutton as selected. The currently selected radiobutton from the radiobutton-group is deselected automatically.

void RadioButtonControl::SetValue (  INT  value  )  [inline]
 

A radiobutton may represent a value, which can be specified.
